introduction: 4 Day Weekend is a music video clip made by 4°C Studio [a Japanese animation studio founded by Koji Morimoto, Eiko Tanaka, and Yoshiharu Sato in 1986] for the song with the same name singed by the English group The Bluetones. In Holland - at Animation Festival 98 - “4-Day Weekend” won the title of "Best Music Video". The animation is a mix of 2d animation and computer graphics. The originality of this song of Bluetones , released as the fourth and final single from their second album, 1998's Return to the Last Chance Saloon, is that it was never played on radio. It only distributed via the Internet.
